Text: For Republicans, it’s not just about controlling access to abortion or contraception. It’s about their never-ending obsession over controlling women’s bodies. https://t.co/xzKQYHwHWG

The Republican agenda: 

1. Tax increases for seniors and working families. 
2. Billionaires continue to pay no income taxes. 
3. Further gut IRS funding to allow rampant tax evasion by wealthy Republican donors. https://t.co/ck97Kq9XZv

The impact from the Shearer’s Foods explosion cuts deeply in Hermiston. My thoughts are with the victims and I’m thankful for the first responders on the scene. I’ve told @UmatillaCounty Chair John Shafer that I stand ready to help in any way that I can to recover and rebuild. https://t.co/iYx9M0LrlH

It should come as no surprise Republicans’ big idea is raising taxes on retired seniors and working parents. At the same time, they celebrate the fact that billionaires often pay no income tax for years, or even decades. This is not an agenda the American people support. https://t.co/ck97Kq9XZv

Russia must face aggressive sanctions from both the United States and our allies in response to its blatant violation of Ukraine’s territory. Unless Vladimir Putin withdraws Russian troops from Ukraine, he is condemning Russia to exist as an international pariah.

In mourning the death and fervently hoping for the recovery of the shooting victims, let’s always remember that normalizing violence against anyone exercising their First Amendment rights in our country cannot be tolerated.

Violence is unacceptable from any quarter. The reckless rhetoric by far-right Republicans that the Jan. 6 insurrection was “legitimate political discourse” is a lie that inflames violence. The killing of a peaceful protester at Portland’s Normandale Park cannot be normalized.

Can’t wait for this Thursday when I’ll have my 1,000th town hall from Eugene where I first fell in love with our state as an @Oregon_Law student.  Here’s how to participate in that virtual #2022townhall for Lane County: https://t.co/DQUNhvG2Lj

My 999th town hall today from @BeavertonLib showed again how Oregonians lead the nation when it comes to participatory democracy. Thanks Washington County for a great online #2022 town hall covering mental health, privacy rights, Ukraine/Russia & more. https://t.co/ygVUKXJ0I3

As chair of @SenateFinance, I’m all in with ending the tax loopholes that let Big Oil companies price-gouge their way to big profits here in Portland & statewide off hardworking Oregonians getting their kids to school, commuting to work or driving as part of their own jobs. https://t.co/czHYFcBbe0

Big thanks to Riley with @GirlScoutsOSW for stopping by last night to drop off my much-anticipated cookie order and #2022townhall fuel. Looking forward to digging into my Tagalongs and Samoas on the way to my 999th town hall today in Washington County. https://t.co/2dqDUQaMCk

A good way to avoid repeating awful chapters in history is to learn from them. That’s why I’m proud to support this significant bill for Japanese Americans in Oregon and across the West who have painful & personal ties to this site.
 https://t.co/b5YpN9H42J

Great questions at today’s online #2022townhall in Columbia County from @SpotlightNews on health care, small business, child care, rural broadband & more. This was my 998th townhall, and I’m grateful to all Oregonians who ask questions & share ideas in this #OregonWay tradition https://t.co/bAaEpzSrZV
Tune in to my 998th town hall, live now from Columbia County: https://t.co/2Ro8e4V1wz

My 998th town hall will be at 3 pm PT today from Columbia County. And my 999th is at 1 pm tomorrow from Washington County. Here’s how Oregonians in those counties can tune in to these #2022townhalls, ask questions & share their ideas: https://t.co/DQUNhvG2Lj

Looking forward to being back in Lane County next Thursday for my 1,000th town hall. Nothing’s been more important in my career in public service than keeping my promise to listen to Oregonians in each of our state’s 36 counties each year. https://t.co/esvzvfaqiC
Fork-tunate to represent a state full of big ideas. #OregonWay https://t.co/T0MBVPu5T5
Good “dill.” https://t.co/NHQ39ppTB3

Republican legislatures are already successfully suppressing the will of voters. Unless the Senate suspends the filibuster to pass ironclad voter protections, imagine how bad these headlines will be come November. https://t.co/RvG3naS0SA

Trace Terrell's testimony about the state of youth mental health care should be a wake-up call for lawmakers nationwide. I encourage young people to share their own stories about this failing system so we can get to work on finding comprehensive solutions. https://t.co/qdaeUatJMt

Big thanks to Trace Terrell for testifying at @SenateFinance about his work on the youth crisis line. This young Oregonian’s powerful insight will help guide the committee to bipartisan solutions that help young people facing mental health challenges: https://t.co/8HpHmzBt1L
Voting at home is simple, easy, and safe. Republicans in DC would have you believe otherwise because they're afraid they can't win elections on their own merits. It's time for nationwide #VoteByMail.

Facial recognition should not be required to access unemployment insurance or any other essential government services. After successfully pushing the IRS to transition away from its use of private facial recognition, now I'm pushing the Department of Labor to do the same. https://t.co/SLfFlA7XD2

So very sorry to learn about the passing of Alireza Aleaziz. As the son of immigrants, I was proud to help the Aleaziz family in 1998 and inspired by this young man’s courage facing major medical challenges. This Oregonian will not be forgotten:
https://t.co/JGFdnR5Hh8

America is losing a generation of young people to an ever-growing mental health crisis. As Chairman of @SenateFinance, I'm all in when it comes to meeting this moment with the big, bold solutions it deserves. https://t.co/V9bBTgxFOF
I was the first U.S. Senator elected entirely by mail. Voting at home is easy, safe, and effective. I won’t stop fighting tooth and nail to give every single American the option to vote by mail.
Happy birthday to the beautiful, resilient, and hard-working state I’m proud to call home. Here’s to another 163 years of doing things the #OregonWay. https://t.co/KPaN3tPgNE
Proud to have India Wynne as an adviser on my team working hard to help Oregonians & providing sound advice on veterans, houselessness & more: https://t.co/xFw59RSwcZ

After pressing with @MartinHeinrich for further transparency about bulk collection, the CIA declassified its report showing problems with its warrantless searches for Americans’ information. I won’t stop fighting for transparency and accountability. https://t.co/aU5BfrQI8E

Local journalism matters. Here’s an example of how on-the-ground reporting by @kennethlipp at the Newport News-Times helped shed light on Oregonians getting evicted through no fault of their own, and led to real solutions. https://t.co/m5D8JCGZbZ

USTR is doing the right thing to protect endangered species and hold Mexico to the promises made in USMCA. Enforcing our trade agreements is critical to ensuring the U.S. gets what we bargained for.
https://t.co/dXdgTqoQMx

Ending federal cannabis prohibition is about ending a key pillar of the failed War on Drugs that disproportionately hurts low-income communities and communities of color. @SenSchumer @SenBooker and I are all in to get this done. https://t.co/UXWuV6HPkX
Stop the #EARNITAct
It didn't even stop ads: https://t.co/QbZxvgg971
It increased violence against sex workers: https://t.co/YmrSt1vRFb
The #EARNITAct is SESTA-FOSTA on steroids. SESTA-FOSTA didn't help victims. It increased sex trafficking: https://t.co/UGj0F5k7l6

It's time to hold companies accountable that rely on algorithms that discriminate against Americans based on race, gender, and age. Experts agree that my #AlgorithmicAccountabilityAct is the way to do it. https://t.co/vAYKGschkH

The monthly child tax credit payments have been a lifeline for millions of American families. If you qualified to receive the monthly payments, you may qualify for additional funds when you file your tax returns this year: https://t.co/9teU6NLArv

I’m working with @SenatorTester @SenatorFischer & @ChuckGrassley on a bipartisan bill that can help keep a lid on these price jumps and help cattle ranchers in Oregon & nationwide: https://t.co/XeFd3xN0Vj

Here’s one more piece of painful evidence showing how consumers suffer in the grocery store when lack of competition in the meatpacking industry drives up meat prices to benefit only a handful of mega-corporations:
https://t.co/uWV2OZ2rUe

This is heartbreaking and unacceptable, and exactly why I'm going to continue my fight for comprehensive solutions that meet this crisis head on. It's past time to ensure every American has access to the mental health care they need.

A staggering number I heard at today's @SenateFinance hearing with @Surgeon_General Murthy: the average delay between the onset of mental health challenges and treatment is 11 years. https://t.co/leb8rbCcZu

Thanks @CJMcCollum for the fantastic memories you gave all of us @trailblazers fans. We’ll never forget your Game 7 against Denver in the 2019 playoffs and so many other great moments these past eight-plus years in #RipCity.

I'd like to thank @Surgeon_General Murthy for joining today's critical @SenateFinance hearing to discuss the urgent need to tackle this crisis. As Chairman, one of my top priorities will be addressing this crisis with comprehensive solutions that meet the moment.

When it comes to mental health care, America is failing its young people. It's past time for Congress to get serious about expanding access to mental health care for every young person, and in the coming months, that's exactly what I'm going to be fighting for. https://t.co/xdVlIPzEDC

Republicans on the Supreme Court just gutted the remainder of the Voting Rights Act, undoing protections Americans fought and died for. Suspending the filibuster to pass ironclad voting protections has never been more important. https://t.co/MFQ4GUwC1h

Happy to see companies like @DaimlerTruckNA in Oregon leading the way on cutting-edge innovation and creating clean energy jobs. I'm working to pass my Clean Energy for America Act to support clean energy practices just like this.
https://t.co/jSmNh3FzP7

This is big: The IRS has notified my office it plans to transition away from using facial recognition verification, as I requested earlier today. While this transition may take time, the administration recognizes that privacy and security are not mutually exclusive. https://t.co/jw7OR7dNo0
Americans shouldn’t have to sacrifice their privacy for security. Full stop. Today I’m calling on the IRS to end its plan to require facial recognition for online accounts. https://t.co/cggpAnc7va
I’ve been proud to back labor my whole career. Now, I’m just as proud to support Congressional staff and any workers in the U.S. Capitol in their efforts to unionize.
Wood you look at that? You better beav-lieve spring is on its way! https://t.co/mXO4yFXrSp
Thanks to @nathanmwilliams for showing such good taste in recommending Otto's in Southeast Portland. Can't wait for my next visit to this favorite neighborhood spot. https://t.co/aQ47sxTmmc

Affordable, widely accessible testing is critical in the fight against COVID. I commend the Biden administration for taking this much-needed step to protect seniors during this public health crisis. https://t.co/xx6XbrKuQ0

Proud to be introducing this much-needed legislation with @SenBooker and @RepYvetteClarke to hold companies accountable for reliance on flawed systems that discriminate against Americans based on age, gender, and race. https://t.co/GKJt5FpMPI

Your ability to get a loan, rent a car, or apply for a job shouldn't depend on your skin color, age, or gender. Today I'm introducing my #AlgorithmicAccountabilityAct to bring transparency and accountability to flawed algorithms that impact every aspect of daily life.

It’s equally important during #BlackHistoryMonth and year-round both to acknowledge the painful past of racism AND to act on reversing that past. Congrats to Erious Johnson Jr. for earning this judicial appointment: https://t.co/07HUdLAjZh

I've spent my career in the Senate fighting to protect kids and aid victims of abuse. But this bill does nothing to turn around the Justice Department’s tragic failure to prioritize child welfare and abuse cases.

Instead, the EARN IT Act threatens the privacy and security of law-abiding Americans. This bill will make it easier for predators to track and spy on children and also harm the free speech and free expression of vulnerable groups.
This sadly misguided bill will not protect children, stop the spread of vile child exploitation material or target the monsters that produce it. https://t.co/7VXht5u8Ip
It’s time for my billionaires income tax. https://t.co/CkSNbQwYjY

Wishing my friend and colleague @SenatorLujan a full and speedy recovery. I look forward to the work ahead fighting together for the priorities that matter to Western families. https://t.co/0idJgwNud5

I was pleased last week when DNI Haines in response to my letter with @JerryMoran acknowledged the urgent need to overhaul our nation's broken classification system. I won't stop pushing intelligence officials to implement much-needed reforms to keep Americans safe. https://t.co/3sgEQffjEB
Wishing everyone celebrating in Oregon and beyond a happy and prosperous #LunarNewYear! #YearOfTheTiger

Oregon has a long & complicated history of racism & discrimination that must be acknowledged. This first day of #BlackHistoryMonth & every day, it’s essential to remember the Black Oregonians who overcame countless barriers & discrimination in order to create powerful change.

Let’s all commit this #BlackHistoryMonth and year-round to commemorating the remarkable contributions of Black Americans, understanding their fight in overcoming systemic racism, and reaffirming our responsibility to root out racial injustice and elevate Black voices in America.

No one should be forced to submit to facial recognition as a condition of accessing essential government services. I'm continuing the press the Biden administration for greater transparency on this new plan and how it will protect consumer data. https://t.co/wpoMqyqWz8

I was proud to fight for this release of nearly 400,000 recordings into the public domain. This is a big win for artists, archivists, and the public. I will continue fighting for balanced IP laws that benefit every American. https://t.co/S4J2ph0uWA

Thanks Jefferson County for bringing such great questions to yesterday’s virtual #2022townhall about mental health, voting rights, tribal water infrastructure & more. And thanks @MadrasPioneer for your Central Oregon hospitality hosting me & providing a plate of tasty cookies https://t.co/dbxAqYPUxq

Thank you to Director Haines for recognizing that our broken classification system is actually damaging national security. I am committed with @JerryMoran to finally getting this fixed.
https://t.co/hRuTO2SwOt

Huge thanks to the @OregonGuard for helping the hard-working nurses, docs & staff I met with today here at @STCHealth in Bend. This is an all-star team going 24-7 to keep everybody in Central Oregon healthy during this pandemic. #GetVaccinated https://t.co/wWetXEr5MK

If America wants to compete in the economy of the future and ensure a free and open internet for people around the world, our government needs to get serious about fighting back against authoritarian censorship. Using the trade tools at our disposal is critical in that fight. https://t.co/sMWrxJLx3p

As the son of parents who fled Nazi Germany for refuge in America, I know my mom and dad never forgot their friends & loved ones killed in the Holocaust. This #HolocaustRemembranceDay may we recommit to learning about the horrors of the past to ensure we build a brighter future.

Enjoyed hearing from Crook County residents who logged on to today’s online #2022townhall to ask great questions on infrastructure, wildfires, recreation, the River Democracy Act & more. And big thanks to the @CntrlOregonian for hosting me here In Prineville. https://t.co/hypUrf3pye

Today’s Clackamas County online #2022townhall hosted here at the @ThePortlandTrib included so many great questions about wildfires, recreation, voting rights, gun violence, transportation & more. Thnx to @PeoplesTH & all who participated in this #OregonWay conversation. https://t.co/HY9DZMbxUh

As the son of a reporter, I very much appreciate local news outlets across our state such as @KOBITV in southern Oregon where newsrooms work 24-7 to keep their communities informed. https://t.co/uU4TtCsjsO https://t.co/5Gbj121ruD

Mental health care for young people isn’t a partisan issue. Thanks to all the young Oregonians who shared their concerns with me yesterday via Zoom about this key topic. As @SenateFinance Chair, I’m committed to finding solutions to this urgent health care challenge. https://t.co/StFQPAn4DR

Poverty is a policy choice. By refusing to extend the life-changing child tax credit payments, 50 Senate Republicans are forcing a generation of mothers and children to go without the help they need to survive. https://t.co/o8hQyPWdd8

Si es residente de los condados de Jefferson, Crook o Clackamas, voy a tener eventos virtuales donde me puedes hacer preguntas. Obtenga más información sobre estos eventos, abiertos a todos, aqi: https://t.co/3cGcudbITA

Reminder that if you’re a resident of Jefferson, Crook or Clackamas County, to check out my upcoming virtual #2022townhalls. Get more information on how to access these open-to-all events: https://t.co/3cGcudbITA

Impressed by all I saw & heard today in Portland at @OHSUNews about how nurses, docs & staff are working hard to test, vaccinate and keep everybody safe during this public health crisis. Tests, vaccinations & masking are key to getting this pandemic in the rearview mirror ASAP. https://t.co/5D9ZRxyMVX

My deepest condolences to my friend Jeanne Moore & all of Frank’s loved ones. I’ll always remember Frank with a smile as I recall his no-nonsense honesty & sense of humor, and w/gratitude for his legacy of making southern Oregon & our state a better place https://t.co/ymlcQJuCzc

So very sorry to hear of the passing of my friend Frank Moore. Oregonians will always have Frank and his wife Jeanne to thank for translating their love of the North Umpqua River into a lifetime of dedication to preserving this natural treasure for all: https://t.co/dCkr6vGVRp https://t.co/GF5mfERPGy

Briefed today at @AsanteHS in Medford about the many challenges the Omicron surge has thrown this hospital & so many others around Oregon working hard to keep providing quality care to everybody coming through their doors. #GetVaccinated https://t.co/32Lw7MQCcq

Great to meet @evanrtucker03 here at the Grants Pass Fred Meyer after today’s online #2022townhall for Josephine County. Our state’s future is bright with young Oregonians like Evan and so many others who care about their communities like he does. https://t.co/Nnegtp4zSc

And thanks to the @GPJOChamber for hosting my virtual #2022townhall this morning from Grants Pass. Enjoyed getting the chance to catch up with Grants Pass Chamber CEO Josie Molloy. https://t.co/CRvAg8FkOx

Josephine County displayed the #OregonWay with flying colors at today’s online #2022townhall discussing voting rights, recreation, the River Democracy Act, the climate crisis, mental health, housing and more. https://t.co/MuO8G3JrTo

The nurses, doctors & staff I met with this morning at @AsanteHS in Grants Pass are working round-the-clock to keep the community safe during this Omicron surge. Southern Oregon can be proud of these dedicated health care workers and their tireless service. #GetVaccinated https://t.co/P7bhgM7iUG

Thanks Douglas County for the robust #OregonWay conversation at yesterday’s online #2022townhall covering the climate crisis, consumer issues, the River Democracy Act, vote-by-mail & more. And thanks to the @nrtoday for hosting me and my laptop here in Roseburg. https://t.co/bT9OmoTfnA

Thanks to Roe v. Wade, access to safe and legal abortion has been a constitutional right for nearly half a century. It’s past time for Congress to codify this constitutional right into law, and ensure access to abortion regardless of income or zip code.

Met yesterday in Roseburg with the staff here at @MMCHealth about all the challenges they’re working hard to overcome with COVID and staffing in rural Oregon. These are true health care heroes. #GetVaccinated https://t.co/hAKU3bPty5

So many reasons that I’m always proud of being a @uoregon Duck. And I found even one more great reason here today at this expanded COVID testing site being provided at Mac Court in Eugene by the university and students. Wonderful work by all. https://t.co/cD0z8F5TBb

Thnx to all at @PeaceHealth_Ore who briefed me today about the heroic efforts here in Lane County to keep Oregonians safe during the pandemic & ensure everybody continues to get quality care. Big kudos to @LaneCoPH & @OregonGuard for playing key roles in this lifesaving work. https://t.co/yGmEm0m34Q

I’m very disturbed that Americans may have to submit to a facial recognition system, wait on hold for hours, or both, to access personal data on the IRS website. While e-filing returns remain unaffected, I’m pushing the IRS for greater transparency on this plan. https://t.co/8l7m2OiPOI

This is further evidence that Congress must pass drug pricing reforms as soon as possible. I will continue fighting tooth and nail to give Medicare the tools it needs to fight back against high prices and deliver relief to seniors. https://t.co/7MZwqhSaKZ

Whether American democracy will survive Donald Trump and his iron grip on the Republican party is still an open question. Making sure Americans can vote and that those votes are counted is step one. There’s no better way to begin than by passing vote at home legislation.

I was the first U.S. Senator elected by mail. My home state of Oregon has been voting by mail for decades. Oregonians know that vote by mail is safe, easy, and effective. Every American deserves the option to vote at home, and I won't stop fighting to make that a reality. https://t.co/z4lPFz6Dma

China's Great Firewall of censorship and digital authoritarianism is spreading among its neighbors. The U.S. must lead the way on digital trade and a free and open internet, or else China will continue to export policies that endanger human rights and democratic values. https://t.co/pYBVEDag9C

COVID tests play a key role in staying safe & getting this public health crisis in our rearview mirror as soon as humanly possible. Here’s how everybody in Oregon & our entire country can order free at-home tests: https://t.co/E8XSJCUo3x

Thanks to @MealsWheelsPpl for letting me call seniors yesterday in Portland & for all the volunteers who do the same as part of the outstanding “Friendly Chats” program that keeps older Oregonians connected to the community https://t.co/UqCUgaHJdu https://t.co/RvUlZ4ZxGU

America has two tax codes: one that's mandatory for working families, and one that allows the ultra-wealthy and corporations to dodge the taxes they owe. I will not stop fighting to fix our nation's broken tax code. https://t.co/0CHbXnA54w
Thanks to my neighbor Riley with @GirlScoutsOSW troop #10506 for coming by yesterday to take my cookie order.  Love the thin mints and samoas. https://t.co/ctSIkDbA5e

Small businesses like Village Coffee here in Portland create jobs and are the backbone of communities statewide. Very nice to meet Andrew today at this business that’s been going strong for 29 years in Multnomah Village. https://t.co/RnbOKkUMkt

Inspired by everything I heard today from Chaleigha and her daughter Justyce here in NE Portland about their hard work and creativity with their business selling health & fitness gear, wellness smoothies and more. https://t.co/v1auQpksA3

Enjoyed catching up today on #MLKDay here in Portland with @CameronWhitten at @BrownHopeOrg in its new space to hear about all the excellent work underway in our community with #blackresiliency and more. https://t.co/VlQTtbf8YP

“Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter."
 
May this #MLKDay serve as a chance to recommit to speaking up in the face of injustice and working together to build on Dr. King’s legacy of equal opportunity for all.

Thanks as well to the @Salem_Statesman for letting me pop open my laptop here in Salem and @PeoplesTH for helping me throw open the digital doors of democracy until in-person town halls are again safe.

Thanks to everybody here in Marion County for an excellent first virtual #2022townhall of the new year. A great opportunity to practice the #OregonWay of bringing people together to work on solutions for voting rights, the climate crisis, wildfires & more. https://t.co/nJZzYSifth

Great to catch up today here in Beaverton with Mayor @laceybeaty and see everybody in her town doing their part to #getvaccinated so Oregon and the country can put this pandemic in the rearview mirror as soon as humanly possible. https://t.co/5FMnsCSAz6

Huge thanks to all the nurses & staff I met today at vaccine clinics in Rockwood & Beaverton working hard to keep Oregonians safe. They & so many others around our state & country are the very definition of health care heroes. #GetVaccinated @latnet_PDX @MultCoHealth @OHAOregon https://t.co/aEAiVo5DXj

Due to the updated Senate schedule, my virtual #2022townhalls scheduled Jan. 18 for Clackamas County; Jan. 19 for Jefferson County; & Jan. 20 for Crook County will be postponed & rescheduled. The online town halls for Marion, Douglas & Josephine counties will go on as scheduled. https://t.co/KYNrik5GsM

I’m pushing for more transparency to ensure taxpayers aren’t subsidizing high-end real estate investments by billionaires without demonstrating the benefit they are providing to low income communities they claim to help.

For years, I’ve been concerned that the Opportunity Zone program gives wealthy investors another opportunity to avoid billions of dollars in taxes without meaningfully benefitting the communities the program was intended to help. https://t.co/Nr300irptZ

In light of a nationwide blood shortage, I have called on HHS and the FDA to change long-disproven policies that stigmatize and prohibit LGBTQ+ blood donors. It’s long past time. https://t.co/FpDz0A7qYn

Best wishes to @Dame_Lillard for a speedy recovery. All of us in #RipCity appreciate how Dame thrills us on the court, and works off the court to help young people & our entire community. https://t.co/LDrcgnuAWS

This is the latest example in a pattern in which Senator Cruz tramples on the important American principle of leaving politics out of U.S. national security matters. My door is open whenever he or his Republican colleagues are ready to work with Democrats and get tough on Russia.

Senator Cruz had an opportunity to come up with serious legislation dealing with Nord Stream 2, but instead he wrote a bill that would hogtie the Senate with procedural votes and obstruct progress on all the other issues that matter to American families.

This is the direct result of Republicans underfunding and deliberately weakening the IRS for decades. Getting Build Back Better across the finish line will give the IRS the resources it needs to serve the American people and ensure wealthy tax cheats pay what they owe. https://t.co/5dMlLegGfH

The only path forward to protect voting rights is by doing away with the filibuster. Senate Democrats can and must use every tool at our disposal to safeguard access to the ballot box for every single American.

Very much looking forward to my first virtual #2022townhalls of the new year in Marion, Clackamas, Jefferson, Crook, Douglas & Josephine counties. Here’s how Oregonians in those counties can participate, share your ideas & ask me any question: https://t.co/M9jOsKewc6

This proposed rule will help ease the financial strain on thousands of independent pharmacies and millions of Medicare beneficiaries across Oregon and nationwide. I’ll keep pushing to deliver relief to these small businesses and consumers alike. https://t.co/5JSwzgJzW5

Great to read how Chuck Sams is already making a positive difference at the @NatlParkService. Chuck is an outstanding Oregonian who our whole state can take pride in for taking his work ethic and #OregonWay good judgment to the national level. https://t.co/dnr07Upxbp

Nothing’s been more important in my public service than listening to Oregonians in each of our 36 counties each year. In 970 in-person town halls + online town halls during COVID, I’ve gotten great ideas/questions. Stay tuned for Monday’s release of my 1st online #2022townhalls

January 6th will forever be remembered as one of democracy's darkest days. There is a lot that still needs to happen to protect our elections and our democracy. Making sure every American can vote and ensuring those votes are counted is step one. https://t.co/sA2WNcZN2W

That’s why strengthening the right to vote is the most important remedy to these anti-American schemes. As long as I serve in the U.S. Senate I will do everything in my power, including overturning the filibuster, to ensure access to the ballot box for every single American.
The people who plotted January 6th, including some sitting members of Congress, are continuing to undermine our democracy in advance of the midterms and the next presidential election.

As our country commemorates the anniversary of that attack, we must remember this was not an isolated incident. It was the violent manifestation of the ongoing Republican effort to end free and fair elections in the United States of America.

Today marks the horrific anniversary of the date domestic terrorists carried out a violent plot in hopes of overturning the results of a U.S. election. Thankfully, the January 6 insurrectionists failed, and mass bloodshed was avoided.

And I’m also proud to be working with @SenJeffMerkley to help Oregon’s cattle ranchers by urging federal regulators to quickly review Oregon’s rules & regulations for a state meat inspection program that meets @USDA standards: https://t.co/5DhsFT2z8P

My bipartisan bill with @SenatorTester @SenatorFischer & @ChuckGrassley can play a key role in the need for increased transparency in cattle markets, delivering relief to producers and consumers alike: https://t.co/XeFd3y43Xj

Glad to have the Biden administration as a partner in the work to lower meat prices by stepping up competition in the meatpacking industry so producers get a fair shake and consumers aren’t paying high prices for meat: https://t.co/8S9ei0W9c0
It's time billionaires pay their fair share. It's time for my billionaires income tax. https://t.co/1xgBK4IikO

Facebook cares more about turning a profit by coddling white nationalists, scammers and anti-democratic right-wing figures than protecting Americans’ private data. Congress must pass strong federal privacy legislation in 2022. https://t.co/W8qhufetJi

There's no denying that 2021 was a year of challenges. But with each new challenge, Oregonians met the moment with unparalleled resilience and compassion. I'm heading into 2022 with a renewed appreciation for what it really means to live the #OregonWay. Happy New Year! https://t.co/LCC8LznyX7

.@SenJeffMerkley and I are urging the Biden administration to green light Oregon’s meat inspection program ASAP. This will deliver much-needed financial relief to ranchers and rural communities, and help stabilize food supply chains in Oregon and beyond. https://t.co/NR5k1EcqGA

While tonight I mourn with Landra and the family, I take heart that America will see a lot of Harry Reid’s legacy of an indomitable spirit, smarts and toughness in the legislative battles ahead in 2022 and beyond.

He trained his colleagues to fight hard & fair, & stand up against special interests. When we were working on health care in 2009, he told me in his usual colorful style how glad he was that insurance companies could no longer stomp all over people with pre-existing conditions.

Harry Reid was a vintage Westerner who had an uncommon knack for common-sense solutions. His hardscrabble upbringing & boxer’s training instilled in him an unmatched work ethic, a sixth sense of what made people tick & compassion for those who needed a fighter in their corner.
